revised_title: Quantum Mechanical Eigenchannel Theory of Unimolecular Dissociation
tldr: This article presents a quantum mechanical eigenchannel theory of unimolecular dissociation, which explains the decay rates of resonances and the internal state distribution of fragments. The theory considers systems with many closed and few open channels, and it can handle interactions other than Coulombic long-range interactions. The authors apply the theory to a simplified model for the dissociation of HCN, demonstrating its potential for understanding chemical reactions and molecular dynamics.
